• Shorts

  • She Did Not Sing, The Poetry Project

    Who can resist a good container? Outlined in silver, the naked couple held hands. A small vine climbed each leg. I thumbed over the pair of sloping shoulders, thick backs, and flat cheeks...

  • Visit to Makon, Wildness

    “We can never go back,” I said softly, offering her a mantra, an antidote for keeping memory at bay. Even now, I hold those words close to my body, low, against the liver...

  • Movement

  • upcoming Alt-Nature @ Counterpath

    In celebration of Saretta Morgan’s new book, Alt-Nature from Coffee House Press, a performance with remy malik and Brian Alarcon.

  • ongoing Movement Workshops: slothing sleuthing, frantic assembly, body language, earthworks, blobjects in touch

  • carpet jaw [sūdjūd] with remy malik

Bo Hwang is an artist and writer working in poetry, movement and things so mundane, “nothing” happens. She lives in Colorado where she is the 2022 Anselm Hollo Fellow at Naropa University. Previously, she was a 2022 Periplus Fellow. Previously, she grew up in Indonesia.

@bohwang__
